data.title: Édouard Mortier, Duke of Trévise Letter Signed
data.meta_description: Sold for $250 | French military commander (1768-1835) and Marshal of the Empire under Napoleon I, who served during both the French Revolutionary Wars and the
data.text:
Description

French military commander (1768-1835) and Marshal of the Empire under Napoleon I, who served during both the French Revolutionary Wars and the Napoleonic Wars. He later became prime minister of France, and was one of 18 people killed in 1835 during Giuseppe Marco Fieschi's assassination attempt on King Louis Philippe I. LS in French, signed “Ed: Mortier,” one page, 7.25 x 9, June 8, 1807. Letter demanding a shipment of medication for the medical post which had not been received by the promised date. In fine condition. Accompanied by an unsigned engraved portrait.

Auction Info

Auction Title: Fine Autograph and Artifacts Featuring Presidents

Dates: #658 - Ended February 08, 2023

This item is Pre-Certified by PSA/DNA
